chargeHist.descr: Operating A Motor Vehicle While Revoked

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion Hearing, 09/21/2022
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:00 AM case called. Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Harold J. Hill Jr. Defendant Harold J. Hill Jr. appeared by video, in custody from Jackson Correctional Facility. Defendant waives right to appear in person.

9:05 AM: Off the record
9:08 AM: Back on the record

States calls State Trooper Justin Glasener (WI State Patrol). State Trooper Justin Glasener is sworn and testifies. Witness identifies the Defendant via video.
Cross examination by Defense.
Redirect by State.
Court questions witness.
Witness is excused.

Defense requests that motion be granted and states reasoning. State requests that motion be denied and states reasoning.

Court orders motion to suppress denied. 

Counsel to contact Branch 1 Judicial Assistant for further scheduling.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Stop and Seizure
Hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 9:58 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Harold J. Hill Jr. appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Harold J. Hill Jr.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information, waives reading, and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. 
Defense indicates they will be filing a motion. Court indicates the motion should be filed by 7/1/2022. 
Motion Hearing to be scheduled with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.
Preliminary Hearing, 04/26/2022
Amending Count 1 to a 6th Offense adding Count 2: Operating w/ PAC 6th Offense and making former Count 2 now Count 3.
Arraignment on June 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(Case called at 2:43 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Harold J. Hill Jr. appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Harold J. Hill Jr. Deputy District Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives right to personal appearance. State calls Trooper Justin Glasener, Wisconsin State Patrol, sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Trooper Glaesner by Defense. Witness excused. State rests and requests bind over. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Case called at 9:28 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Harold J. Hill Jr. appeared by video from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Harold J. Hill Jr. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests Preliminary Hearing to set. 
Preliminary Hearing: 04/26/2022 at 2:30 PM.
Copy of letter from the WSP, notifying citation for PAC issued with court date scheduled for 05-05-22 at 11 am.

Case called at 9:41 AM. 
Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Harold J. Hill Jr. appeared in court, Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared in court for Attorney Alicia Linzmeier.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 3/7/22 at 2:00 PM.
Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on March 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.

Hearing on February 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 11:08 AM- by Zoom)  Defendant Harold Hill Jr. appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. District Attorney Peter Rindal appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the Complaint. State requests $2,500 cash bond- recites failures to appear and has pending OWI 5th offense in another county. Defense requests signature bond. Court orders $1,500 cash bond with various conditions. 
Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived.
